content.title: 'It brings back sad memories': Former firefighter pushes for stricter CO laws after multiple poisonings - CBC News
content.desc: A former firefighter who lost four family members to carbon monoxide poisoning is urging Canadians to be aware of the risks and take the necessary life-saving precautions this winter. His warnings come after 13 people were hospitalized in Vancouver when they were exposed to carbon monoxide in an office on Wednesday. A day later on Thursday, two adults and three children from Barrier, B.C., were airlifted to Vancouver after being poisoned in their home. "It brings back sad memories," said John Gignac, who now runs the Hawkins-Gignac Foundation for Carbon Monoxide Education in Ontario. "It's ...

content.title: Carbon monoxide poisoning at office sends 13 to hospital - CBC News
content.desc: Carbon monoxide poisoning sent 13 office workers in Vancouver to hospital on Wednesday. British Columbia has seen in a spike in carbon monoxide poisonings in the last few weeks, as colder weather has people turning on their heating systems.
